item.title: Three personal repositories I maintain
item.description: My dotfiles, such as my neovim config and my IPython startup scripts. IPython startup scripts are run when opening a new IPython kernel. Being a data scientist and a heavy Jupyter notebooks user, having Numpy, Pandas, and other common libraries auto-imported saves me having to type the same lines at the top of every notebook. Furthermore, Pandas and matplotlib can be configued to use default styles when displaying a dataframe or a figure.

item.title: About
item.description: About I live in London and work at Poplar Studio as a machine learning engineer, developing various ML-powered products in the augmented reality space. From Nov 2019 to Apr 2021 I was a data science consultant at FTI Consulting, albeit in a somewhat product-focused role. Before that, I graduated with an MMath (a 4-year integrated Master’s) in Mathematics from Oxford University. During my university years, I did a few internships, including a stint at BibliU in London and Bestat Data in Tokyo.

item.title: CV
item.description: I’m a full stack data scientist, currently working on AR technology, deep learning solutions, end-to-end deployment, with a preference for pytorch. Poplar Studio, April 2021 — Present Responsible for ML and R&D at an early-stage start-up, reporting to the CTO. Trained deep learning models to solve ecommerce sizing problems. Wrote training framework in PyTorch and PyTorch Lightning. Deployed as API service using FastAPI and AWS Lambda serverless. Load testing with Locust.
